annotation: A guide to Swedish adjective comparison, covering basic, semi-special, and special forms with rules and examples.
Comprehensive guide to Swedish adjective forms and agreement with en-words, ett-words, and plural nouns, including common exceptions.
Explains how to use 'vilken' and 'vad' for exclamations with adjectives in Swedish.
Rules for using time adverbs (NU and DÅ) with present perfect and preterite tenses in Swedish.
Covers the three forms of Swedish location adverbs: position, destination, and 'from position'.
Detailed breakdown of Swedish noun forms: singular and plural, definite and indefinite, including irregular nouns.
The five golden rules for using definite and indefinite forms of nouns in Swedish.
Guide to forming short answers (kortsvar) in Swedish using 'det' and appropriate verbs.
Rules and examples for when to use the prepositions 'i' and 'på' for different types of locations in Swedish.
Comprehensive guide to Swedish time expressions, prepositions for time, and telling the clock.
Explains Swedish frequency expressions using 'om', 'i', and 'per', and how to say 'every X days'.
Explains the use of reflexive possessive pronouns (sin, sitt, sina) versus regular possessive pronouns in Swedish.
Guide to Swedish standalone pronouns for people and things, such as 'någon', 'ingen', 'allt', and 'alla'.
Comparison between Swedish present perfect and preterite tenses, with rules on when to use each.
Basic formation of the Swedish present perfect tense using 'har' and the supinum form.
Guide to forming the Swedish preterite (past tense) for regular and irregular verb groups.
Focuses on the supinum form of Swedish verbs used to form the present perfect tense.
Using the Swedish present tense for the future and rules for time adverbs and prepositions.
Detailed guide on when to use definite and indefinite articles in Swedish, including fixed expressions.
Quick reference for Swedish comparison forms of common adjectives and adverbs like 'många', 'få', and 'lite'.
Table of Swedish subject and object pronouns with English translations.
Rules for positive and negative agreement in Swedish using 'också' and 'inte heller'.
Table of Swedish possessive pronouns for all persons and noun genders.
Guide to Swedish pronunciation of 'g', 'k', and 'sk' before hard and soft vowels.
Rules for using prepositions with Swedish seasons for habitual, past, and upcoming time.
Explains when to use the infinitive marker 'att' in Swedish and when to omit it (especially with modal verbs).
Guide to common Swedish auxiliary verbs (hjälpverb) and their usage with the infinitive form.
Explains the use of Swedish position verbs (sitter, står, ligger och) to describe ongoing actions.
Comprehensive overview of Swedish verb groups and their different forms (imperative, infinitive, present, past, supinum).
Guide to forming indirect speech in Swedish, covering statements, questions, and word order rules.
Explains the use of 'som' and 'där' in Swedish relative clauses.
Guide to Swedish subordinating conjunctions (subjunktjoner) for time, contrast, and purpose.
